action.action-desc: Mr. Schiff (for himself, Mr. Langevin, Mr. Carson, Mr. Cleaver, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Grijalva, Ms. Jacobs of California, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Mr. Nadler, Ms. Newman, Ms. Schakowsky, and Ms. Leger Fernandez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide for a corporate responsibility investment option under the Thrift Savings Plan.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Employees Sustainable Investment Act.

subsection.text: Section 8438(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (10) as paragraphs (3) through (11), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:
the term Corporate Responsibility Stock Index Fund means the fund established under subsection (b)(1)(G).
in paragraph (10), as redesignated by paragraph (1) of this subsection, by striking paragraph (8)(D) each place it appears and inserting paragraph (9)(D).
Section 8438(b)(1) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (E), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (F), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
a Corporate Responsibility Stock Index Fund as provided under paragraph (6).

paragraph.text: Section 8438(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: The Board shall select a minimum of one index which is a commonly recognized, passively managed index comprised of stocks (from the United States or international equity markets) that have been analyzed and selected based on criteria consistent with the purposes of this paragraph.
The criteria under clause (i) shall at a minimum include—

subclause.text: environmental practices (including greenhouse gas emissions and contribution to climate change);

clause.text: The historical performance of each index selected under this subparagraph shall be comparable to that of the other investment funds and options available under this subsection.

subparagraph.text: The Corporate Responsibility Stock Index Fund shall be invested in a portfolio designed to replicate the performance of the index in subparagraph (A) (or, if more than one index is selected, the overall average performance). The portfolio shall be designed such that, to the extent practicable, the percentage of the Corporate Responsibility Stock Index Fund that is invested in each stock is the same as the percentage determined by dividing the aggregate market value of all shares of that stock by the aggregate market value of all shares of all stocks included in such index (or indexes).
